intro: Coprosma coffaeoides, commonly known as the New Zealand native coprosma, is a shrub native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage. The plant typically grows in coastal and lowland areas, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. Its small, white flowers are followed by dark blue berries that are an important food source for native birds. Coprosma coffaeoides is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits in its natural habitat.
